trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery"></xref> control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PasswordRecoveryDesigner"></xref> class.
Gets the action list collection for the control designer.

A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> object that contains the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> items for the control designer.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PasswordRecoveryDesigner"></xref> control allows resizing.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control allows resizing; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the collection of predefined automatic formatting schemes to display in the **Auto Format** dialog box for the associated control at design time.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection"></xref> object that contains the predefined schemes for the control.
Retrieves the HTML markup that is used to display the associated control at design time.
The HTML markup used to represent the control at design time.
Retrieves the HTML markup to display all regions at design time.
A collection of control designer regions for the associated control.
The design-time HTML markup for the associated control, including all control designer regions.
Returns the content for an editable region for the design-time view of the associated control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion"></xref> object to get content for.
The persisted content for the region, if the control designer supports editable regions; otherwise, an empty string ("").
Retrieves the HTML markup that provides information about the specified exception.
The exception that occurred.
The design-time HTML markup for the specified exception.
Initializes the designer and loads the specified component.
The control being designed.
Used by the designer class to add properties to, or remove properties from, the **Properties** grid at design time or to shadow properties of the associated control.
The properties for the class of the component.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PasswordRecoveryDesigner"></xref> control uses an outer table container to apply inline CSS style rules.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PasswordRecoveryDesigner> control uses an outer `table` element to apply inline style rule in the markup.
You can remove the outer table container by setting this property to `true`.
This gives you flexibility in how you apply CSS style rules for the control.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control uses an outer table container to apply inline CSS style rules; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Establishes the content for an editable region of the control at design time.
An editable design region that is contained within the control.
The content to assign for the editable design region.
Gets a collection of template groups, each containing one or more template definitions.
A collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup"></xref> objects.
The default is an empty <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the control designer uses a temporary preview control to generate the design-time HTML markup.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
